simplesect.title: DESCRIPTION
simplesect.simpara: Read text, such as commit messages, notes, tags and branch descriptions, from the standard input and clean it in the manner used by Git.

listitem.simpara: remove trailing whitespace from all lines
collapse multiple consecutive empty lines into one empty line
remove empty lines from the beginning and end of the input
add a missing \n to the last line if necessary.

simplesect.simpara: In the case where the input consists entirely of whitespace characters, no output will be produced.
NOTE: This is intended for cleaning metadata, prefer the --whitespace=fix mode of for correcting whitespace of patches or files in the repository.

listitem.simpara: Skip and remove all lines starting with comment character (default #).
Prepend comment character and blank to each line. Lines will automatically be terminated with a newline. On empty lines, only the comment character will be prepended.

simplesect.title: EXAMPLES
simplesect.simpara: Given the following noisy input with $ indicating the end of a line:
simplesect.screen: |A brief introduction $ | $ |$ |A new paragraph$ |# with a commented-out line $ |explaining lots of stuff.$ |$ |# An old paragraph, also commented-out. $ | $ |The end.$ | $
simplesect.simpara: Use git stripspace with no arguments to obtain:
simplesect.screen: |A brief introduction$ |$ |A new paragraph$ |# with a commented-out line$ |explaining lots of stuff.$ |$ |# An old paragraph, also commented-out.$ |$ |The end.$
|A brief introduction$ |$ |A new paragraph$ |explaining lots of stuff.$ |$ |The end.$
